text: Joseph Benjamin Pignatano (August 4, 1929 – May 23, 2022) was an American professional baseball player and coach. He played for the Brooklyn / Los Angeles Dodgers (1957–60), Kansas City Athletics (1961), San Francisco Giants (1962) and New York Mets (1962). He won the World Series twice in 1959 and 1969. Pignatano was born in New York City. Pignatano died on May 23, 2022 in Naples, Florida from problems caused by dementia, at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:Kansas City Athletics players Category:San Francisco Giants players Category:New York Mets players Category:Sportspeople from New York City Category:Sportspeople from Florida
title: Joe Pignatano
